key_risks: Exposure to airline financial health due to economic downturns or disruptions in air travel
Regulatory risks from changes in international aviation regulations
High debt levels and potential impact from rising interest rates
Geopolitical risks from global operations and trade disputes
environmental_issues: Need to align fleet with stricter emissions and environmental standards
social_issues: Dependence on airline customers' financial stability impacting employees and stakeholders

sources.title: AerCap - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: AerCap Holdings N.V. is an American-Irish aviation leasing company headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, with offices around the world. [2] AerCap is listed on the NYSE with the ticker 'AER'. It became the largest aviation leasing company in the world following the acquisition of ILFC in 2014, [3] and GECAS from GE in 2021, [4] for over $30 billion.
